Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations identified in the report, a
written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not
obtained and maintained compliance for rules found in repeat non-
compliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
There have been two different physical assault incidents of youth Yes
in care in which injuries were sustained at the hands of the same
caregiver. In both instances, agency workers were aware and did
not file a 3200 or initiate a special evaluation. There was no
safety plan completed for the second incident. On 9/19/2021, a
third incident took place in which the same caregiver assaulted
another youth. This incident may have been prevented if the
agency had followed protocols in the first two events.
Additional Findings Yes

ALLEGATION:
There have been two different physical assault incidents of youth in care in which
injuries were sustained at the hands of the same caregiver. In both instances,
agency workers were aware and did not file a 3200 or initiate a special evaluation.
There was no safety plan completed for the second incident. On 9/19/2021, a third
incident took place in which the same caregiver assaulted another youth. This
incident may have been prevented if the agency had followed protocols in the first
two events.
INVESTIGATION:
On 10/7/2021 I reviewed the on-line complaint document and spoke with
Complainant X. Complainant X reported the complaint information put forth related
to Child C and Child D was revealed while assessing a new child assault issue
3

involving Household Member (HHM) B, against Child E that was received on
9/19/2021. Child C is a temporary court ward. Child D and Child E are Michigan
Children Institute (MCI) wards. All three children are placed in the foster home of
Foster Parent A, who is licensed though St Clair County Department of Health and
Human Services (DHHS). Complainant X reported the current child’s assault could
have been prevented if the agency’s foster care and adoption staff had reported the
prior incident. Complainant X reported being concerned that the agency did not
report the incidents to Foster Parent A’s certifying agency, St. Clair County DHHS.
Complainant X advised that on 10/6/2021 FCW 2 had to be advised to file a children
service referral. St Clair County DHHS reported Ennis did not contact them related
to these alleged assault matters.
Complaint related to Child C:
In addition to the above, Complainant X reported or indicated the following:
 In August 2020 Foster Care Worker (FCW) 2 and Director 1 were informed
that Household Member (HHM) B (age 17 then), adopted son of Foster
Parent A who babysat and assisted with behavior management of the
children, restrained Child C causing injuries.
 Complainant X spoke with FCW 2, the agency worker for Child C and Child D,
with respect to the new assault allegation by HHM B on Child E. FCW 2
disclosed that 18-year-old HHM B assaulted Child C and the agency had a
safety plan in place.
 The alleged assault matter related to Child C was not reported to law
enforcement or Children Services.
 A special evaluation was not initiated pertaining to the foster parent.
 FCW 2 and Director 1 attempted to safety plan with Foster Parent A, who is
licensed through the St Clair County DHHS. Foster Parent A was
uncooperative at first because he did not want HHM B to be included in a
safety plan.
 HHM B reportedly admitted to restraining Child C and Child C having injuries.
Complainant X provided me email documentation related the 9/19/2021 complaint
against Foster Parent A which contained an email statement from FCW 2 related to
Child C. That statement from FCW 2 indicated the following:
 In September 2020 there were complaints of HHM B restraining Child C. FCW
2 was the worker at the time. Child C was 12 and HHM B was 17. FCW 2
attempted to put a safety plan in place with Foster Parent A. The day she tried
to present the safety plan to Foster Parent A, he had received news of a
relative’s death. He would not agree to any terms of that safety plan. FCW2
reported that safety plan was created on 9/16/2020.
On 10/17/2021 I interviewed Director 1 about the allegations regarding Child C by
telephone. Director 1 reported awareness of the incident with Child C. She said she was
advised by the supervisor that on 8/14/2020 Child C reported that HHM B pushed him.
Then on 9/13/2020 HHM B restrained him. On 9/16/2021 they did a safety plan and also
completed an incident report. Director 1 said, she thought they had contacted Children
4

Services about the incident. I advised her a 3200 was not documented in this child’s
MISACWIS file. Director 1 was to check on that and the incident report. If a 3200 was
available, she would provide a copy to me along with the incident report. She reported
they would not have contacted the police about the incident. They would have let
Centralize Intake take care of that. Director 1 reported not being sure whether they
contacted St, Clair County DHHS related to the incidents, but thought they did so.
No incident report, 3200, or case contact to St. Clair County DHHS was provided to
me.
On 10/19/2021 I interviewed FCW 2 by telephone related to the allegations. FCW 2
confirmed being the FCW for Child C, and Child C’s placement with Foster Parent A
being via a borrowed bed arrangement. Foster Parent A is licensed by St Clair County
DHHS not Ennis. She also confirmed that there was an incident related to HHM B
restraining and assaulting Child C. She recalled Child C having a mark or scratch on his
neck from the incident but could not recall whether this incident with the scratch was
mixed in with others where restraints by HHM B was alleged. She said Child C had a
lot of behavior issues in the foster home and was AWOLing a lot. She said many of the
times that Child C would AWOL, Child C would run to his mother, who would report
Child C reported being restrained by HHM B. FCW 2 said Child C’s mother did not
know whether the restraints were true or whether Child C just wanted to run to her
house. FCW 2 admitted she did not report these alleged restraints to Foster Parent A’s
licensing agency.
FCW 2 reported with regards to the incident of Child C having a mark or scratch on his
neck from an incident with HHM B, Child C’s Day Treatment Night Watch (DTNW)
program brought that to her attention. She thought DTNW reported the incident to the
authorities, because they contacted her about seeing the scratch/mark on Child C’s
neck. Child C reported to DTNW staff he was restrained by HHM B. Child C was not
actually sure how the mark came about. FCW 2 did not ask DTNW whether they
contacted Children Services about this incident. Nor did she follow up with them to
assert whether they had. She did not contact Children Services. She said, there were a
lot of Children Services complaints in the foster home, and she thought she had spoken
with someone from Children Services in 2020 about Child C’ s placement being a
borrowed bed placement or other matters; but she could not recall the specifics. Nor
when, or with whom that occurred. FCW 2 could not recall if FCS 3 reported the
incidents to Children Services or anyone in Children Services.
FCW 2 did not recall writing an incident report about the matter. She acknowledged not
reporting the matter to St. Clair County DHHS, the certifying agency, so that a special
evaluation could be initiated pertaining to Foster Parent A’s license. FCW 2 reported
that she and her supervisor, FCS 3 developed a safety plan for Child C. The plan was
that HHM B would not place his hands on Child C or any other foster child. Foster
Parent A would not commit to that safety plan and refused to sign it. FCW 2 was unable
to produce a written copy of that plan. She submitted an email to me about it on
10/20/2021, but no report was attached. On 9/16/2020, the same day Foster Parent A
5

refused to sign the aforementioned safety plan, Director 1 intervened and revised the
safety plan with Foster Parent A. Foster Parent A signed the revised plan.
On 10/20/2021 I interviewed FCS 3 by telephone related to this complaint. FCS 3
recalled the incident. She affirmed FCW 2’s reporting of how FCW 2 became aware of
the incident/Child C having a mark or scratch on his neck. The reporting came via an
email from the DTNW program; and the email said DTNW staff were contacting
Children Services.
FCS 3 acknowledged that she did not contact Children Services or St. Clair County
DHHS, the certifying agency. She also acknowledged there are likely requirements for
their agency to report concerns to a certifying agency about that agency’s foster
parents; but she was not sure of them. She provided me a copy of a 9/17/2020 email
the agency sent out in regard to the safety plan that Foster Parent A refused to sign.
She said this email was sent to the St Clair County DHHS licensing, POS Monitor and
POS Supervisor.
My review of that email showed the email:
 Was from Director 1 to FCW 2, FCS 3 and three “DHHS” staff, inclusive of a
named prior DHHS licensing worker, but not the supervisor.
 The email advised of Foster Parent A’s refused to sign a safety plan and
request for a FTM (Family Team Meeting).
 Did not indicate it was alleged that HHM B restrained Child C or that it was
alleged Child C had an injury.
My review of FTM referenced above showed:
 It was held on 9/24/2020 reportedly to discuss Child C’s placement. The FTM
did not document attendance by anyone from DHHS- Licensing.
 The detail and outcome section did not include information of a discussion
related to Child C being restrained by HHM B or alleged or reported injuries to
Child C from the incident.
On 10/27/2021 I spoke with St Clair County DHHS Licensing Supervisor X0 and St Clair
County DHHS Licensing Worker XX by telephone, separately.
 DHHS Licensing Supervisor X0 reported them not being the licensing worker
nor supervisor of the foster home in 2020. She said they did not know about the
allegation pertaining to Child C. She, as well as DHHS Licensing Worker XX
reported learning about this matter when the assault allegation by HHM B to
Child E came forth.
DHHS Supervisor X0 reached out to the prior licensing supervisor and worker by
email on 10/27/2021 to ask whether one of them were made aware of the
reported incidents in Foster Parent A’s home in 2020. DHHS Licensing
Supervisor X0 advised these prior DHHS licensing staff of the alleged restraint
incidents by HHM B of Child C on 8/25/2020 and 9/13/2020. She further advised
them that Foster Parent A’s provider record was reviewed and there were not
6

contacts. She indicated in the email, “however, we are checking with you directly
in the event that licensing was aware but forgot to add the contact.”
 DHHS Licensing Worker XX, affirmed DHHS Licensing Supervisor X0’s
reporting. She reported, FCW 2, nor anyone else from the agency contacted her
related to an incident. DHHS Licensing Worker XX reported reaching out to
FCW 2 by emails when completing Foster Parent A’s 2021 annual report (CWL-
4004). She tried to get feedback and input from FCW 2 pertaining to the foster
parent’s care and supervision of children FCW 2 had placed in the foster home.
FCW 2 did not respond to DHHS Licensing Worker XX’s emails for information.
On 10/28/2021 I was included in an email response to DHHS Licensing Supervisor X0
from DHHS Licensing Supervisor X0X. DHHS Licensing Supervisor X0X replied that
licensing was not aware of the reported 8/25/2020 or 9/13/2020 attacks events reported
as occurring in Foster Parent A’s foster home related to Child C by HHM B.
On 10/28/2021 I interviewed Adoption Worker 4 by telephone. Adoption Worker 4
reported she had no information related to the allegations pertaining to Child C. She
reported Child C is a Temporary Court Ward (TCW) and she has no contact with TCWs.
Reviewed
Child C’s MISACWIS case record which showed:
 Child C is a temporary court ward.
 He was placed in Foster Parent A’s foster home on 7/24/2020-8/2/2020.
 Child C was back and forth between Foster Parent A’s foster home and
detention centers in Macomb County between 8/3/2020 and 12/21/2020. He
was last placed in Foster Parent A’s home from 12/21/2020 until 2/5/2021.
 Various social contacts of Child C AWOLing from Foster Parent A’s foster
home.
 An 8/14/2020 social work contact related to: a home visit following a telephone
call from Child C’s mother about Child C AWOLing. Child C reporting HHM B
laid hands on him by pushing him. Foster Parent A reporting HHM B retaliated
on Child C after Child C first laid hands on HHM B. FCW 2 contacting her
supervisor and the agency director for guidance on this matter. FCW 2
indicating it was determined Child C would remain in the home and Child C was
okay with that.
 A 9/13/2020 social work contact by FCW 2 of an email from a DTNW worker to
FCW 2, and other DTNW staff. This email indicated or showed:
 The DTNW staff reported that Foster Parent A called them about Child
C having pushed two of the children in the home, then AWOLing and
returning with Child C’s mother.
 DTNW staff went to the home and Foster Parent A explained Child C
was messing with the bathroom door and was attempting to open it
while another child was using the bathroom. The two boys got into an
argument about the incident. Child C attempted to fight the other child
and HHM B restrained Child C. That’s when Child C ran off. Child C
7

was seen to have a cut on the back of his neck and small red mark on
his collar bone. That, thereafter, Foster Parent A conversed about the
incident with Child C’s mother and Child C became upset, cursing
Foster Parent A and ultimately rode off on his bike.
 The DTNW director responded to the email related to keeping the
agency up to speed on issues with Child C. Her asking what to do
about getting medication for Child C.
 Child C’s Probation Officer, FCW 2 and DTNW director conversed back
and forward about the medication issue/a pursuit with Child C ’s mother
about the medication.
 There was no documentation in this social work contact of anyone
contacting and or planning to contact Children Services about the
alleged assault of Child C and reported marks on his body.
 A 9/16/2021 social work contact related to an Ennis office visit with Foster
Parent A related to a safety plan. Foster Parent A refusing to sign the safety
plan. Director 1 intervening with Foster Parent A. Director 1 talking with Foster
Parent A, Child C and Child C’s mother, and getting Foster Parent A to sign a
revised safety plan.
 A safety plan that indicated if Child C become upset, frustrated, overwhelmed
or angry…, do not physically restraint or stop him. The plan listed a number of
support contact persons or numbers to call, along with an agency number to
call after 5:00pm.
 A safety plan which Foster Parent A reportedly refused to sign which indicated
the contact persons/numbers as indicated in the above Safety Plan. This one
include the following if Child C became upset…: That no one in the home,
including Foster Parent A, HHM B or any other child in the home will physically
restraint Child C for any reason. This includes bear hugging, wrestling, pinning
him to the ground, pushing, shoving, or grabbing in any manner.
 No documentation of a report of suspected abuse or neglect (DHS-3200) filed
by Ennis.
 No social work contact or other documentation showing the incident of restraint
by HHM B, or Child C having marks was reported to St. Clair County DHHS.
Foster Parent A’s MISACWIS record which showed:
 Foster Parent A is licensed as a foster family group home for five children ages
5-17.
 HHM B was 18 as of a date in January 2021.
 A 5/10/2021-5/9/2021 renewal reevaluation (CWL-4004) completed by St Clair
County DHHS which did not show documentation of a special investigation
related to an alleged inappropriate discipline or assault on Child C during the
licensing period.
 Per my review of social work contacts between 7/20/2020 and 12/31/2020, no
documentation of a contact from an Ennis staff to St. Clair County DHHS
8

licensing related to an assault, discipline or maltreatment allegation pertaining to
this foster home with respect to Child C.
Complaint related to Child D
Complainant X indicated and reported the following related to this complaint matter:
 Three months ago (from the date of this complaint) FCW 2 and an unknown
adoption worker were informed MCI ward, Child D was assaulted by HHM B
whose was now 18.
 FCW 2 learned that Child D’s mouth was bleeding following the assault.
 FCW 2 spoke with Child D about the situation; and Child D reported the
information was accurate. Child D reported he was scared to return to this
foster home. Child D begged FCW 2 to not report the information because he
feared he would be assaulted again.
 Child D also advised FCW 2 he is harassed and punished for having contact
with his brother.
 FCW 2 did not report this information to law enforcement or Children Services.
 FCW 2 reported she spoke with her supervisor, Foster Care Supervisor (FCS)
3 and Director 1 about this incident with Child D. FCW 2 reported it was
decided they would file a complaint after Child D moved to a new placement.
This was because it would not do any good; and they reportedly had nowhere
else to place Child D.
 Foster care and Adoption did not complete a safety plan around the reported
incident. A special evaluation and complaint was not generated.
 Complainant X had contact with Child D’s sibling, Child F. Child F had reported
his siblings get assaulted in their foster home regularly. Child F reported FCW 2
had gone to the foster home and gotten Child D. That Child D’s mouth was
bleeding.
 FCW 2 was contacted about the above. FCW 2 confirmed the injury and did
nothing, as previously mentioned.
On 10/17/2021 I interviewed Director 1 about these allegations by telephone. Director 1
reported not being aware of allegations of Child D being harmed by HHM B. She said if
Child D had reported being fearful of going back to the foster home, and had reported
someone was assaultive to him, they would not have sent him back there. She denied
having knowledge of Child D having a busted or bleeding mouth from an incident with
HHM B. She reported being aware of Child F reporting that all of his siblings
(approximately 15 of them), including Child D, were being maltreated in their foster
homes. Director 1 reported that was in August of 202. She directed FCW 2 to
investigate the allegations made by Child F. I asked Director 1 to provide
documentation of her directive to FCW 2 regarding investigating the allegations made
by Child F, or any information, (emails, incident reports, referrals to Children Services)
that supported that she or FCW 2 had looked in the allegations made by Child F. I did
not receive any such documentation.
9

On 10/19/2021 I interviewed FCW 2 by telephone related to these allegations. FCW 2
reported sometime between the end of July or first of August of this year, Child D’s
brother, Child F reported to her that HHM B smashed Child D’s face against or into the
garage. Child F reported this information to her during a time she was transporting
Child F to visit his sister. Child F reported the incident had happened sometime in
November of 2020. FCW 2 said Child F was also living in Foster Parent A’s foster home
in November of 2020. Therefore, she asked Child F why he didn’t report this information
to her back then. Child F reported he had just found out about it. FCW 2 reported,
after learning of this information from Child F, she called her supervisor, who was
Director 1, at the time. Director 1 advised her to speak with Child D.
FCW 2 reported she was unable to speak with Child D right away. She spoke with Child
D on 8/25/2021 while transporting him from a detention center to the office. Child D
confirmed that he was assaulted by HHM B. Child D was not sure of the exact date of
the incident. He reported the incident was a couple of months ago, not November 2020.
FCW 2 asked Child D why hadn’t he reported it to her. He responded that because,
“workers don’t’ believe kids.” FCW 2 said she asked Child D whether he was injured
from the incident; and Child D said his mouth was bleeding. FCW 2 said, Child D was
placed in a foster home with another of his brothers for the night. The agency searched
for a placement for him the next day without success. FCW 2 said she spoke with Child
D about his placement options. She said, Child D did not say he did not want to go
back to Foster Parent A’s home. Child D “just looked nervous” (FCW 2 did not elaborate
on this); and said “Okay”. Child D went back to Foster Parent A’s home because they
did not have a placement for him. FCW 2 reported, she asked Director 1 what to do
about the allegation of what HHM B had done and reporting it. FCW 2 reported it was
discussed that given Foster Parent A was the only likely placement option for Child D,
the incident happening months ago, and Child D not reporting it, Director 1 said “We
could wait” until Child D moved, to report the incident. FCW 2 did not report completing
an incident report or safety plan around this incident. She emailed me on 10/20/2021,
her last day employment with Ennis. She reported she had attached an informal safety
plan she had set up with Child D while Child D was in the other foster home, but no
such document was attached.
FCW 2 acknowledged knowing she is a mandated reporter. She stated that’s why she
asked her supervisor what to do. She said, after Director 1 said to wait about the
reporting, Child D went back to Foster Parent A’s home. FCW 2 denied any new
allegations of harm to Child D coming forth after Child D returned to Foster Parent A’s
foster home. She admitted an incident came up related to another child in the foster
home in September 2021. That incident involved Child E and inappropriate behavior by
HHM B with that child. She did not complete an incident report about it. She did not do
a safety plan at the time, because there was an open investigation by Children
Services. She did not know whether if she had done more related to reporting the other
incidents that the one with Child E may not have occurred.
On 10/20/2021 I interviewed FCS 3 by telephone related to this complaint. FCS 3
reported not being told of an incident related to Child D. She reported not having
10

information about this allegation. She acknowledged another complaint had come forth
related to Child E and provided a copy of the safety plan completed.
On 10/27/2021 I spoke with St Clair County DHHS Licensing Supervisor X0 and St Clair
County DHHS Licensing Worker XX by telephone, separately. DHHS Licensing
Supervisor X0 reported they did not know about the allegation pertaining to Child D.
She and DHHS Licensing Worker XX learned about this matter when the assault
allegation by HHM B to Child E came forth.
DHHS Licensing Worker XX, affirmed DHHS Licensing Supervisor X0’s reporting. FCW
2, nor anyone else from the agency contacted her related to the 2021 incident
pertaining to Child D. As reported earlier in this report, DHHS Licensing Worker XX
reached out to FCW 2 by emails to obtain feedback from FCW 2 related to the
supervision of children FCW 2 had placed Foster Parent A’s foster home. FCW 2 did
not respond to DHHS Licensing Worker XX’s emails. St. County Clair DHHS was never
made aware of a need to open a special evaluation on the foster home.
On 10/28/2021 I interviewed Adoption Worker 4 by telephone. Adoption Worker 4
reported being Child D’s adoption worker since April 2020. She denied Child D ever
reporting assault allegations against HHM B; or reporting he was afraid to go back to
that foster home. If, he had, she would have filed a 3200. She said FCW 2 never told
her that Child D made such allegations. She reported if the incident was documented in
Child D’s Updated Service Plan (USP) she would not have learned about it that way
because she does not review the USPs. She completes quarterly adoption progress
reports. She conferences quarterly with the FCW on the status of the adoption and what
may be happening on the child’s case in general. She reported two quarterly case
conference this year with foster care about Child D’s case; and FCW 2 never brought up
these allegations by HHM B. Nor was she aware of them. Adoption Worker 4 stated,
again if she had known, she would have filed a 3200.
Reviewed:
Child D’s MISACWIS case record which showed.
 Child D is an MCI.
 He was placed in Foster Parent A’s foster home on 6/1/2020 to 8/14/2021. After
a 11-day detention stay (8/14/2021-8/25/2021), and a one day stay in another
foster home (8/25/2021- 8/26/2021), Child D returned to Foster Parent A’ foster
home on 8/26/2021. He remains in this placement.
 A 9/1/2021 safety plan signed by the agency staff and Foster Parent A for Child
D related to preventing child on child sexual conduct.
 No documentation in MISACWIS of a safety plan with Foster Parent A related to
the allegations FCW 2 reported Child F and Child D advised her of related to
HHM B. Nor that Child D had a bloody mouth from the incident. Nor did FCS 3
provide one when she sent me a safety plan for all the children. Those plans
included: Ones for Child C outlined previously in this report; one for Child E
completed on 9/20/2021 after the 9/19/2021 allegation of a physical assault of
11

Child E by HHM B. Three others related to another foster child, all for August
2021.
 No documentation of a Children Services referral (DHS-3200) related to the
allegations pertaining to Child D.
 No social work contact documenting what FCW 2 reported Child F reported to
